main event: A military sergeant and his son observed a bright, fast-moving unidentified object over Point Lookout, Long Island, New York on October 5, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared to pass near the ocean, which was illuminated.
A smaller object was observed inside the larger object as it passed overhead.
The object made a wide turn, extending almost to the southeast and western horizons before heading northeast.
The object was described as moving faster than any aircraft the sergeant had ever seen, with no noise.
The sergeant's son was the only other known observer of the incident.
location: Point Lookout, Long Island, New York
witnesses: a military sergeant and his son
